content.prompt: The function ​g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} has the property that for each time the input values double, the output values increase by 1{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. Which of the following could be the graph of y=gx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} in the xy{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-plane?

choices.label:
​

Moving from left to right:

  • The curve begins at the point with approximate coordinates (negative 2 comma 0.2).
  • The curve trends gradually up to the right and passes through the following points with approximate coordinates:
    • (0 comma 1)
    • (1 comma 2)
    • (2 comma 4)
    • (3 comma 8)
  • The curve ends at just beyond the point (3 comma 8).

​

Moving from left to right:

  • The curve begins at the point with approximate coordinates (0.1 comma negative 2.2).
  • The curve trends gradually up to the right and passes through the following points with approximate coordinates:
    • (1 comma 0)
    • (2 comma 1)
    • (4 comma 2)
    • (6 comma 2.6)
    • (8 comma 3)
  • The curve ends at the point (8 comma 3).

​

Moving from left to right:

  • The line begins at the point with approximate coordinates (negative 1.4 comma negative 2.5).
  • The line moves up and to the right and passes through the following points with coordinates:
    • (negative 1 comma negative 2)
    • (0 comma 0)
    • (1 comma 2)
    • (2 comma 4)
    • (3 comma 6)
    • (4 comma 8)
  • The line ends at just beyond the point (4 comma 8).

​

Moving from left to right:

  • The line begins at the point with coordinates (negative 2 comma negative 1).
  • The line moves up and to the right and passes through the following points with coordinates:
    • (0 comma 0)
    • (2 comma 1)
    • (4 comma 2)
    • (6 comma 3)
    • (8 comma 4)
  • The line ends at the point (8 comma 4).

topic.text: 2.14: Logarithmic Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
